measure.CatchLine: Imposes requirement to procure and maintain workers' compensation insurance on independent contractor that is exempt from licensing by Construction Contractors Board and is residential contractor.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Imposes requirement to procure and maintain workers' compensation insurance on independent contractor that is exempt from licensing by Construction Contractors Board and is residential contractor. 
	Permits board to revoke, suspend or refuse to issue or reissue contractor's license to licensee if licensee assists or contracts with person that licensee reasonably should have known was unlicensed, and unlicensed person performs work as contractor, or if licensee knowingly assists or contracts with unlicensed person and person performs work as contractor. 
	Specifies sanctions that board may impose on person for assisting or contracting with unlicensed other person that performs work as contractor. 
	Takes effect on 91st day following adjournment sine die.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to construction contractors; creating new provisions; amending ORS 701.035, 701.046, 701.098 and 701.992; and prescribing an effective date.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to construction contractors; prescribing an effective date.
measure.AtTheRequestOf: (at the request of Representative Paul Holvey)
measure.FiscalImpact: May have fiscal impact, but no statement yet issued
measure.RevenueImpact: May have revenue impact, but no statement yet issued

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
